snippet: California has imposed $16 million in penalties and fines in a case demonstrating the importance of state laws requiring the disclosure of political donations.
abstract: Editorial welcomes news that $16 million in penalties and fines have been imposed by California on independent spending groups, a record in a campaign finance case; contends that effort demonstrates the importance of state disclosure laws and aggressive enforcement, particularly since Congress has refused to pay attention to these abuses on a national level.
lead_paragraph: California has imposed $16 million in penalties and fines in a case demonstrating the importance of state laws requiring the disclosure of political donations.
